page.title: 16FARMING IN ARNPRIOR
page.content: The 10 farms all have some animals with sheep being predominant. Only one small farm has no sheep and two of the mainly arable farms to the north have only small flocks of 40 sheep. Further south the flocks vary between 200 and 600 animals. In total the farms have more than l800 sheep producing about 3000 lambs per year. Blackface and blackface cross are typical, but other breeds such as Greyface, Cheviot, Suffolk and Border Leicester are also present. Lambing occurs from February to April, clipping is done in June and the sheep are dipped against parasites in July or August. Meat is the main value in sheep, but the wool also brings a small return. The animals are bought and sold at Kildean market, Stirling.
